name: resynthesize
content:
resynthesize verb [T]
(CHEMICAL PRODUCTION)
Add to word list
Add to word list
chemistry, biology
  specialized to produce a substance again by a chemical reaction in plants or animals: Enzymes present in the tissues are activated, sucrose is metabolized, and chlorophyll is resynthesized. This chlorophyll-like fluid is capable of re-synthesising carbohydrate bodies from carbon dioxide.
More examplesFewer examplesIt takes a huge amount of time to re-synthesize promising compounds for further study.Animals are able to analyse proteins in the process of digestion, and resynthesize the resulting amino acids into new and different proteins.

resynthesize verb [T]
(SOUND PRODUCTION)
physics
  specialized to produce sound again electronically: To limit variability, resynthesized speech from the same two speakers is used in the study. Because of the difficulty of achieving natural-sounding resynthesised speech, real speech data were resynthesised.
More examplesFewer examplesSpeech samples were resynthesized, and participants were asked to identify the regional accent for each.
